image.altText: A school sign says that the school is closed for the day.

props.synopsis: The ACT has closed 16 public schools today, with several others partially closed due to potential asbestos contamination.

title.children: Canberra schools closed over asbestos risk; reopening update due Sunday

image.altText: Pink sand in a dish with a spoon.

props.synopsis: Schools in Canberra and Brisbane are closed today due to asbestos in decorative coloured sand.

title.children: Asbestos found in coloured play sand, prompting school closures

image.altText: Four types of coloured sand products have been recalled.

props.synopsis: Fifteen public schools in Canberra are closed today, and several others are partially closed, due to potential asbestos contamination in coloured sand sold at dozens of stores across Australia. Here is what we know.

title.children: What to do if you have recalled coloured sand product in your home

image.altText: Three tower waterslides, all in a significant state of disrepair.

props.synopsis: Canberra's only water park will remain shut for the summer despite promises by the site's owners it would reopen by mid-November.

title.children: Big Splash confirms at 'eleventh hour' that water park will remain shut

image.altText: A car on a police trailer with police officers standing nearby all next to a lake with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The 39-year-old will remain in custody after a judge rejected his request for bail to attend drug rehabilitation.

title.children: Man who leapt into lake to escape police chase denied bail

image.altText: sign saying yass valley council on a red brick building

props.synopsis: The Yass Valley Council defers a decision on whether to raise rates by at least 40 per cent as it looks to make savings in various areas.

title.children: Yass Valley Council considering raising rates by up to 58pc

image.altText: A man with short blonde hair stands speaking, with a woman with long blonde hair standing behind him.

props.synopsis: To be the leader of the Canberra Liberals you need to be thick-skinned, have a lot of persistence, and be very confident — and if Mark Parton's first press conference in the role is anything to go by, he might just be the perfect fit.

title.children: Who is the ACT's new opposition leader that wants to 'leave shit behind'?

image.altText: Proposed site of Russian Embassy in Canberra

props.synopsis: The lease was granted to Russia in 2008, but was withdrawn when parliament passed a new law citing ASIO advice that the planned embassy could pose a threat to national security.

title.children: Russia loses High Court battle with Commonwealth over embassy site

image.altText: A building sign that reads 'ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal'.

props.synopsis: An international student has been awarded $10,000 in compensation after a tribunal found she was unfairly evicted from her university accommodation after she made complaints about noisy students.

title.children: Student who complained about noise unfairly evicted from uni housing

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: The bus driver who crashed and killed 10 wedding guests while injuring 25 others in the NSW Hunter Valley has lost an appeal on the severity of his sentence.

title.children: Wedding bus crash driver loses court appeal against his sentence

image.altText: Reflection of person holding umbrella below Nasdaq sign

props.synopsis: The ASX falls steeply in response to a sharp drop on Wall Street overnight, which was led by a big decline in tech stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX drops sharply after Wall St tumbles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Is this the start of a 'correction'?

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande smile at each other and hold hands

props.synopsis: Video shared across social media shows a man jumping over a crowd-control barrier, running towards Grande and putting his arms around the singer.

title.children: Cynthia Erivo pushes Australian 'serial intruder' off Ariana Grande at event

image.altText: rbui

props.synopsis: The former president of Spain's national football federation, who made headlines after his behaviour following the final of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, has had eggs thrown at him during the launch of his book.

title.children: Luis Rubiales, famed for World Cup kiss, pelted with eggs at book launch

image.altText: Two women and two men standing at a podium talking to reporters

props.synopsis: While many Liberals who wanted to keep net zero say they are happy with the position the party has landed on, some despondent moderates fear electoral oblivion in metropolitan seats.

title.children: Liberal moderates split over net zero move, with some fearing for city seats

image.altText: A tall thin rocket takes off from launch pad, vertically, against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Blue Origin has successfully launched the 98-metre New Glenn rocket with a pair of NASA spacecraft destined for Mars.

title.children: Blue Origin launches huge rocket carrying twin NASA spacecraft to Mars

image.altText: Eli Katoa crouches down with a trainer near him

props.synopsis: NRL star Eliesa Katoa faces more time in hospital when he returns to Melbourne as he recovers from a brain bleed after playing for Tonga.

title.children: 'Long way to go': Katoa to be moved to Melbourne hospital from NZ

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Virginia Giuffre and Ghislaine Maxwell posing for a picture.

props.synopsis: The former prince has repeatedly denied ever meeting Ms Giuffre, including during an infamous interview with the BBC in 2019.

title.children: Epstein email says Andrew had photo taken with accuser Virginia Giuffre

image.altText: A possum-skin quilt built from squares etched with messages about the promise of the treaty process.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of treaties exist between First Nations people and governments around the world. One state in Australia just became one of them.

title.children: Victoria's treaty is here. What does it mean? And is one coming to my state?

image.altText: A Bedford disability support service building.

props.synopsis: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas says he will "definitely not" go to Brazil for COP negotiations, and instead will prioritise saving disability employment provider Bedford.

title.children: SA Premier will prioritise saving Bedford over COP negotiations in Brazil

image.altText: A grain silo looms in front of a starry purple, pink and green sky

props.synopsis: Another week is behind us Can you recall the big news stories of the past seven days?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Black Friday sales, a stunning aurora and a whole lot of bagpipes

image.altText: A car crash site.

props.synopsis: Lanlan Yang allegedly refused to take a breath test or give a version of events to police after a collision that left a person badly injured.

title.children: Lawyer 'perplexed' amid media attention for Rolls-Royce crash case

image.altText: A young girl in a school uniform poses in front of a garden

props.synopsis: Parents of children at a Sydney school where a five-year-old girl was fatally struck are demanding action to improve road safety after it emerged two more children were hit by cars nearby before the girl's death.

title.children: Parents demand action as three children hit by cars near Sydney school

image.altText: Ben Stokes reacts after the wicket of Jacob Bethell

props.synopsis: Ben Stokes appears embarrassed with almost every single one of his six wickets as England's bowling attack leaves much to be desired in their only tour match before the Ashes opener in Perth.

title.children: Stokes reactions tell full story of England's struggles in Ashes warm-up

image.altText: A dark-haired man in a suit speaks at a lectern in front of an "AFL draft" backdrop.

props.synopsis: Another AFL draft has arrived, offering dozens of teenage footballers the chance to realise their dreams. Here is everything you need to know.

title.children: When is the AFL draft and how does it work? Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A female golfer looks down the fairway after her ball after completing her first shot on a hole at an LPGA tournament.

props.synopsis: Kai Trump, teenage granddaughter of US President Donald Trump, has a rough start to The Annika tournament after receiving a sponsors invite to take part in the LPGA Tour event.

title.children: Trump's granddaughter last in LPGA debut after receiving wildcard

image.altText: Burnt pieces of plane in shed

props.synopsis: An investigation into a fatal light plane crash that claimed three lives at an Illawarra Airport has so far found no mechanical faults in the aircraft.

title.children: Investigators find no faults with plane involved in fatal crash

image.altText: A photo of a man with red hair and a blue shirt staring into the camera.

props.synopsis: Michael Simon Wilson has pleaded not guilty to more than 60 charges, including rape, and possessing and transmitting child abuse material.

title.children: Man with alleged links to accused childcare paedophile to stand trial

image.altText: A purple and green sky with the silhouettes of big trees

props.synopsis: The strength of the latest geomagnetic storms has seen the aurora australis light up skies across a larger part of the country than usual.

title.children: They're called the southern lights. But they dazzled Australians further north

image.altText: Australian Federal Police officers raid a home.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide paedophile who posted images online "boasting" about his crimes has been sentenced to at least 14 years in prison. WARNING: This story contains details of sexual abuse that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Adelaide man jailed over 'deeply confronting' child abuse offences

image.altText: A close-up of a hand holding a paintbrush and painting a black circle on a red canvas, with paint pots nearby.

props.synopsis: The truth behind claims of "white hands on black art" will be tested in the SA Supreme Court as one of the country's best-known Aboriginal art groups sues Rupert Murdoch's national masthead for defamation.

title.children: The Australian newspaper sued over 'white hands on black art' reporting

image.altText: Two happy dogs, one large and one small, on a beach.

props.synopsis: The huge range of dog breeds that exists today is often thought of as a modern phenomenon, but new research suggests this vast diversity started thousands of years ago.

title.children: Once wolves became dogs they quickly diversified, study shows

image.altText: A man in khaki shorts and a hat stands on rocks overlooking a rugged tree-lined gorge.

props.synopsis: A WA pastoralist says he will not stand in the way of the bullets aimed at the donkeys on his remote property, but he will not kill the animals he says have had a positive environmental impact.

title.children: Grazier accepts donkey culling decision but will not do it himself

image.altText: a victorian era looking homestead

props.synopsis: A Victorian-era manor that hosts ghost tours and promotes itself as Australia's most haunted house is on the market for the first time in more than half a century.

title.children: Buyers from across the country drawn to 140-year-old 'haunted' mansion
